column2: JD, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this med for 10yrs and have had wonderful results, but now my pharmacist is having problems filling my prescription.  I would like to know what is happening.  Pls dont tell me that it is being taken off the market.  This has been the best!!

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken this medication since 1999; however recently I have been unable to refill my script in the past 45 days due to Mfg. backorders. What is the problem and is their a comparable substitute?

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
andythor, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took Serzone for 2 years from 1999 to 2001 during the most stressful and deepest depression I have ever been through. Although I have been depressed most of my life, after taking Serzone I felt cured and after 2 years of treatment I came off the medicine and actually did rather well for 4 years. After the "liver scare" most providers were unwilling to prescribe nefazodone in 2005 when I required treatment again. Lexapro had a lot of side-effects. After another 5 years of treatment with Lexapro, Wellbutrin, Prozac, and Zoloft, and a new psychiatrist, I started back on Serzone (nefazodone) a couple weeks ago and the improvement is unbelievable. This medication is just superior in treating my depression and I have just decided to monitor my labs and enjoy life again.

column2: Puma Girl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've been taking it for 10 years. Have tried several other antidepressants which caused unacceptable S/E's. Liver tests are fine, no nausea if taken with food. It has given me my life, still have highs and lows but within acceptable range. I sleep well. If I don't take it, I can feel the dark fog moving back in. Thanks, Nefazodone, for saving my life!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for 12 years.   It has given me my life back!  I am now on the smallest dosage possible, twice a day, but find the weepy's come back if I miss a dose or 2.

column2: Jeff, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I recently switched to Nefazodone from Lexapro (which I took for 7 years). I was hoping the sexual side effects I had from Lexapro would go away, but they did only briefly as I was on low dosages of both. I still have them with Nefazodone, although it is slightly better now.In terms of how I feel I Nefazodone is great. I feel "normal" now compared to before. I wasn't even aware of how bad I felt on Lexapro until I got off of it- it made me very depressed and clouded my thinking somewhat. The Nefazodone works great for anxiety and the depression I was feeling on Lexapro is almost completely gone. I also feel like I can work and operate much more effectively and clearly now. I continue to take regular blood tests for liver function, but have had no problem. I give Nefazodone two thumbs up!

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column2: Gratefull, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this med for 14 years with great results.  I am no longer depressed, and I took other drugs and suffered serious s/e's and didn't get such a response as with nefazodone.  I am experiencing no s/e's and my dose has not had to be increased.  My liver tests have all been normal and unchanged. I am very happy.  I hope I will always have this drug.  Before I tried elavil, nortriptaline, prozac, and other horrible meds that did next to nothing for me and made me sick.
if you cannot deal with the side effects of ssri drus this is a great alternative. only one that works for me.

column2: barb123, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on serzone/Nefazodone since about 1996 and it has worked great for me before i would not even go out of the house taking this i felt like i got my life back i take 150 twice a day and it is real importing to take as directed because after a few years i cut my dose in half my self and I'll tell you it came back but I'm OK know i take it like I'm suppose to

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this med for about a month.  I have mild anxiety with depression.    It makes me feel sluggish and tired, a bit out of it even though I take it at night.  I am only on 150mg so I possibly  need to be on a higher dose, which would probably make me even more tired......not sure what I think of it yet.

column2: wellnow, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have bee using htis drug since 1995, shortly afte rinception... after trying tricyclicis, Prozak, Zolosft.. etc..  This is the only drup that reduced my anticipatory anxiety and virtually eliminated the panic attacks that resulted from ruminations....  I curently take 200 mig per day, was originally taking 400 mg per day, always at night....

column2: lakota, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with Major Depression Disorder, May 1998. I tried 14 different drugs for depression. Nefazodone(SERZONE) along with Lamictal has saved my life. I would highly recommend giving it a try. Prozac was a big no-no for me. It made me very suicidal. I take 600mg of Nefazodone and 200mg of Lamictal (used as a mood stabilizer)every evening. This is the best combination for me. I've been taking this for about 4 years and I've really not noticed any side effects, except sleepiness about 2 hrs. after I take Nefazodone. I am very happy with this combination. All the other drugs I've tried, caused stomach problems, weight gain or made my depression even worse than it already was.

column2: junebug, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I have very bad anxiety and I cry at anything. I have cut my self and clawed. I started out taking this drug of half a pill three times a day. Now I am down to one a day and it doesn't help. They are 150mg each pill.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a person with chronic depression.  I have some blurry vision with nefazodone.  I take 450 mg. every day, it does make me dizzy and groggy, so I take all of the pills at night during or after dinner.  For me, it caused bad nausea and tummy aches only if I did not take it with food or a full stomach.

column2: penelope, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: sluggishness, dizziness, clumsiness

column2: perezhombre@aol.com, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i was put on this drug as an alternative to zoloft. zoloft made me feel very good until the evening when i began to experience a sudden deppression. this is something i had not experienced in the past. i was put on this med for manic episodes. i have been titrating myself on this new drug (new for me) and it has in fact made an extreme difference in my ability to normalize in social situations. i am now fun to be around and can interact with anyone without that constant manic and dry mouth feeling. i am fascinated with the number of people i can now interact with without the constant fear of going over the top.

column2: bunkster, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I take serzone/nefazodone for social anxiety.  It works very well.  My friends/family who knew me before I started this med noticed an immediate change.  I was much more chatty in social situations and less shy.  My mother said she hadn't seen me like that since I was a toddler.  And my friends who've met me since are stunned to hear that I'm actually very shy.
